courses.title: Programming I
courses.description: Introduction to programming using a high-level language. Topics include program design, basic data types, control structures, functions, arrays, and debugging techniques.

courses.title: Programming II
courses.description: Continuation of Programming I. Advanced programming concepts including object-oriented programming, recursion, file processing, and data structures.
prerequisites: COSC 111 with grade of C or better

courses.title: Data Structures
courses.description: Study of fundamental data structures including arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, and graphs. Analysis of algorithms and complexity.
prerequisites: COSC 112 with grade of C or better

courses.title: Computer Architecture
courses.description: Introduction to computer organization and architecture. Topics include number systems, digital logic, processor design, memory hierarchy, and assembly language programming.

courses.title: Algorithms
courses.description: Design and analysis of algorithms. Topics include sorting, searching, graph algorithms, dynamic programming, and computational complexity.

courses.title: Software Engineering
courses.description: Principles and practices of software development. Topics include software lifecycle, requirements analysis, design patterns, testing, and project management.

courses.title: Database Systems
courses.description: Database design and implementation. Topics include relational model, SQL, normalization, transaction processing, and database administration.

courses.title: Operating Systems
courses.description: Principles of operating system design and implementation. Topics include process management, memory management, file systems, and system security.

courses.title: Computer Networks
courses.description: Introduction to computer networking. Topics include network protocols, Internet architecture, network security, and distributed systems.

courses.title: Programming Languages
courses.description: Study of programming language concepts and paradigms. Topics include syntax, semantics, functional programming, and language implementation.

courses.title: Artificial Intelligence
courses.description: Introduction to artificial intelligence. Topics include search algorithms, knowledge representation, machine learning, and neural networks.

courses.title: Computer Graphics
courses.description: Fundamentals of computer graphics. Topics include 2D and 3D graphics, transformations, rendering, and graphics programming.

courses.title: Cybersecurity Fundamentals
courses.description: Introduction to cybersecurity principles. Topics include cryptography, network security, security protocols, and ethical hacking.

courses.title: Senior Capstone I
courses.description: First part of senior capstone project. Students work in teams to design and implement a significant software project.

courses.title: Senior Capstone II
courses.description: Continuation of Senior Capstone I. Project completion, testing, documentation, and presentation.

courses.title: Machine Learning
courses.description: Introduction to machine learning algorithms and applications. Topics include supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and deep learning.

courses.title: Web Development
courses.description: Full-stack web development. Topics include HTML, CSS, JavaScript, server-side programming, and web frameworks.

courses.title: Mobile App Development
courses.description: Development of mobile applications for iOS and Android platforms. Topics include native and cross-platform development.

courses.title: Computer Vision
courses.description: Introduction to computer vision and image processing. Topics include image filtering, feature detection, and object recognition.

courses.title: Independent Study
courses.description: Independent research project under faculty supervision. Students work on advanced topics in computer science.

courses.title: College Algebra
courses.description: Fundamental algebraic concepts including functions, equations, and graphing. Prerequisite for programming courses.

courses.title: Calculus I
courses.description: Differential calculus including limits, derivatives, and applications. Required for CS degree.

courses.title: Calculus II
courses.description: Integral calculus including techniques of integration and applications. Required for CS degree.

courses.title: Calculus III
courses.description: Multivariable calculus including partial derivatives and multiple integrals. Required for CS degree.

courses.title: Differential Equations
courses.description: Ordinary differential equations and their applications. Required for CS degree.

courses.title: Discrete Mathematics
courses.description: Mathematical foundations for computer science including logic, sets, combinatorics, and graph theory.
